function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'x < 2' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'x < 2' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'y < 3' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'y < 3' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'x < 2' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'y < 3' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'x (line 4)' used after its definition?
Does the value assigned to 'y (line 4)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Is variable 'z' live at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'x' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Is the statement 'for (x = 0; x < 2; x++)' unreachable?
Is this statement not dead: “for (y = 0; y < 3; y++)”?
